info.title: Akkudoktor-EOS
info.description: This project provides a comprehensive solution for simulating and optimizing an energy system based on renewable energy sources. With a focus on photovoltaic (PV) systems, battery storage (batteries), load management (consumer requirements), heat pumps, electric vehicles, and consideration of electricity price data, this system enables forecasting and optimization of energy flow and costs over a specified period.

post.description:

Deletes all cache files.

get.description:
Get the current configuration.

Returns:
    configuration (ConfigEOS): The current configuration.

put.description:
Update the current config with the provided settings.

Note that for any setting value that is None or unset, the configuration will fall back to
values from other sources such as environment variables, the EOS configuration file, or default
values.

Args:
    settings (SettingsEOS): The settings to write into the current settings.

Returns:
    configuration (ConfigEOS): The current configuration after the write.

Update a nested key or index in the config model.

Args:
    path (str): The nested path to the key (e.g., "general/latitude" or "optimize/nested_list/0").
    value (Any): The new value to assign to the key or index at path.

Returns:
    configuration (ConfigEOS): The current configuration after the update.

schema.description: The nested path to the configuration key (e.g., general/latitude).

get.description:
Get structured log entries from the EOS log file.

Filters and returns log entries based on the specified query parameters. The log
file is expected to contain newline-delimited JSON entries.

Args:
    limit (int): Maximum number of entries to return.
    level (Optional[str]): Filter logs by severity level (e.g., DEBUG, INFO).
    contains (Optional[str]): Return only logs that include this string in the message.
    regex (Optional[str]): Return logs that match this regular expression in the message.
    from_time (Optional[str]): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter logs not older than this.
    to_time (Optional[str]): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter logs not newer than this.
    tail (bool): If True, fetch the most recent log entries (like `tail`).

Returns:
    JSONResponse: A JSON list of log entries.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of log entries to return.

get.summary: Fastapi Energy Management Optimization Solution Get
get.description: Get the latest solution of the optimization.
Get the latest energy management plan.

Deprecated: Electricity Market Price Prediction per Wh (€/Wh).

Electricity prices start at 00.00.00 today and are provided for 48 hours.
If no prices are available the missing ones at the start of the series are
filled with the first available price.

Note:
    Electricity price charges are added.

Note:
    Set ElecPriceAkkudoktor as provider, then update data with
    '/v1/prediction/update'
    and then request data with
    '/v1/prediction/list?key=elecprice_marketprice_wh' or
    '/v1/prediction/list?key=elecprice_marketprice_kwh' instead.

post.description:
Deprecated: Total Load Prediction with adjustment.

Endpoint to handle total load prediction adjusted by latest measured data.

Total load prediction starts at 00.00.00 today and is provided for 48 hours.
If no prediction values are available the missing ones at the start of the series are
filled with the first available prediction value.

Note:
    Use '/v1/prediction/list?key=loadforecast_power_w' instead.
    Load energy meter readings to be added to EOS measurement by:
    '/v1/measurement/value' or
    '/v1/measurement/series' or
    '/v1/measurement/dataframe' or
    '/v1/measurement/data'

get.description:
Deprecated: Total Load Prediction.

Endpoint to handle total load prediction.

Total load prediction starts at 00.00.00 today and is provided for 48 hours.
If no prediction values are available the missing ones at the start of the series are
filled with the first available prediction value.

Args:
    year_energy (float): Yearly energy consumption in Wh.

Note:
    Set LoadAkkudoktor as provider, then update data with
    '/v1/prediction/update'
    and then request data with
    '/v1/prediction/list?key=loadforecast_power_w' instead.

schema.title: Response Fastapi Gesamtlast Simple Gesamtlast Simple Get

get.description:
Deprecated: PV Forecast Prediction.

Endpoint to handle PV forecast prediction.

PVForecast starts at 00.00.00 today and is provided for 48 hours.
If no forecast values are available the missing ones at the start of the series are
filled with the first available forecast value.

Note:
    Set PVForecastAkkudoktor as provider, then update data with
    '/v1/prediction/update'
    and then request data with
    '/v1/prediction/list?key=pvforecast_ac_power' and
    '/v1/prediction/list?key=pvforecastakkudoktor_temp_air' instead.

post.description:
Deprecated: Optimize.

Endpoint to handle optimization.

Note:
    Use automatic optimization instead.

ConfigEOS.title: ConfigEOS
ConfigEOS.description:
Singleton configuration handler for the EOS application.

ConfigEOS extends `SettingsEOS` with support for  default configuration paths and automatic
initialization.

`ConfigEOS` ensures that only one instance of the class is created throughout the application,
allowing consistent access to EOS configuration settings. This singleton instance loads
configuration data from a predefined set of directories or creates a default configuration if
none is found.

Initialization Process:
  - Upon instantiation, the singleton instance attempts to load a configuration file in this order:
    1. The directory specified by the `EOS_CONFIG_DIR` environment variable
    2. The directory specified by the `EOS_DIR` environment variable.
    3. A platform specific default directory for EOS.
    4. The current working directory.
  - The first available configuration file found in these directories is loaded.
  - If no configuration file is found, a default configuration file is created in the platform
    specific default directory, and default settings are loaded into it.

Attributes from the loaded configuration are accessible directly as instance attributes of
`ConfigEOS`, providing a centralized, shared configuration object for EOS.

Singleton Behavior:
  - This class uses the `SingletonMixin` to ensure that all requests for `ConfigEOS` return
    the same instance, which contains the most up-to-date configuration. Modifying the configuration
    in one part of the application reflects across all references to this class.

Attributes:
    config_folder_path (Optional[Path]): Path to the configuration directory.
    config_file_path (Optional[Path]): Path to the configuration file.

Raises:
    FileNotFoundError: If no configuration file is found, and creating a default configuration fails.

Example:
    To initialize and access configuration attributes (only one instance is created):
    ```python
    config_eos = ConfigEOS()  # Always returns the same instance
    print(config_eos.prediction.hours)  # Access a setting from the loaded configuration
    ```

Provides information about the currently active operation mode and transition history.
Used to track the current state of the actuator.

operation_mode_factor.description: Factor with which the operation mode should be applied (0 to 1).

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

DDBCInstruction.title: DDBCInstruction
DDBCInstruction.description:
Instruction for Demand Driven Based Control (DDBC).

Contains information about when and how to activate a specific operation mode
for an actuator. Used to command resources to change their operation at a specified time.

EnergyManagementPlan.title: EnergyManagementPlan
EnergyManagementPlan.description:
A coordinated energy management plan composed of device control instructions.

Attributes:
    plan_id (ID): Unique identifier for this energy management plan.
    generated_at (DateTime): Timestamp when the plan was generated.
    valid_from (Optional[DateTime]): Earliest start time of any instruction.
    valid_until (Optional[DateTime]): Latest end time across all instructions
        with finite duration; None if all instructions have infinite duration.
    instructions (list[BaseInstruction]): List of control instructions for the plan.
    comment (Optional[str]): Optional comment or annotation for the plan.

values.description: Array of measured energy values. Shall contain at least one item and at most one item per 'commodity_quantity' (defined inside the PowerValue).

EnergyMeasurement-Input.title: EnergyMeasurement
EnergyMeasurement-Input.description:
Captures a set of energy meter readouts taken at a specific point in time.

Energy is defined as the cummulative power per hour as provided by an energy meter.

This model records multiple energy values (for different commodity quantities)
along with the timestamp when the meter readouts were taken, enabling time-series
analysis and monitoring of energy consumption or production.

Note: This is an extension to the S2 standard.

finished_at.description: Indicates when the Timer will be finished. If the DateTime is in the future, the timer is not yet finished. If the DateTime is in the past, the timer is finished. If the timer was never started, the value can be an arbitrary DateTimeStamp in the past.

FRBCTimerStatus.title: FRBCTimerStatus
FRBCTimerStatus.description:
Current status of an FRBC Timer.

Indicates when the Timer will be finished.

FeedInTariffCommonProviderSettings.title: FeedInTariffCommonProviderSettings
FeedInTariffCommonProviderSettings.description: Feed In Tariff Prediction Provider Configuration.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Feed in tariff provider id of provider to be used.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Feed in tariff provider id of provider to be used.

FeedInTariffFixedCommonSettings.title: FeedInTariffFixedCommonSettings
FeedInTariffFixedCommonSettings.description: Common settings for elecprice fixed price.

FeedInTariffImportCommonSettings.description: Common settings for feed in tariff data import from file or JSON string.

version.title: Version
version.description: Configuration file version. Used to check compatibility.

data_output_subpath.title: Data Output Subpath
data_output_subpath.description: Sub-path for the EOS output data directory.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90, north is positive (ISO 19115) (°)

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees, within -180 to 180 (°)

GeneralSettings-Input.title: GeneralSettings
GeneralSettings-Input.description:
Settings for common configuration.

General configuration to set directories of cache and output files and system location (latitude
and longitude).
Validators ensure each parameter is within a specified range. A computed property, `timezone`,
determines the time zone based on latitude and longitude.

Attributes:
    latitude (Optional[float]): Latitude in degrees, must be between -90 and 90.
    longitude (Optional[float]): Longitude in degrees, must be between -180 and 180.

Properties:
    timezone (Optional[str]): Computed time zone string based on the specified latitude
        and longitude.

version.title: Version
version.description: Configuration file version. Used to check compatibility.

data_output_subpath.title: Data Output Subpath
data_output_subpath.description: Sub-path for the EOS output data directory.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90, north is positive (ISO 19115) (°)

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees, within -180 to 180 (°)

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: Compute timezone based on latitude and longitude.

GeneralSettings-Output.title: GeneralSettings
GeneralSettings-Output.description:
Settings for common configuration.

General configuration to set directories of cache and output files and system location (latitude
and longitude).
Validators ensure each parameter is within a specified range. A computed property, `timezone`,
determines the time zone based on latitude and longitude.

Attributes:
    latitude (Optional[float]): Latitude in degrees, must be between -90 and 90.
    longitude (Optional[float]): Longitude in degrees, must be between -180 and 180.

Properties:
    timezone (Optional[str]): Computed time zone string based on the specified latitude
        and longitude.

individuals.title: Individuals
individuals.description: Number of individuals (solutions) to generate for the (initial) generation [>= 10]. Defaults to 300.

generations.title: Generations
generations.description: Number of generations to evaluate the optimal solution [>= 10]. Defaults to 400.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Fixed seed for genetic algorithm. Defaults to 'None' which means random seed.

penalties.title: Penalties
penalties.description: A dictionary of penalty function parameters consisting of a penalty function parameter name and the associated value.

pv_prognose_wh.title: Pv Prognose Wh
pv_prognose_wh.description: An array of floats representing the forecasted photovoltaic output in watts for different time intervals.

strompreis_euro_pro_wh.title: Strompreis Euro Pro Wh
strompreis_euro_pro_wh.description: An array of floats representing the electricity price in euros per watt-hour for different time intervals.

einspeiseverguetung_euro_pro_wh.title: Einspeiseverguetung Euro Pro Wh
einspeiseverguetung_euro_pro_wh.description: A float or array of floats representing the feed-in compensation in euros per watt-hour.

preis_euro_pro_wh_akku.title: Preis Euro Pro Wh Akku
preis_euro_pro_wh_akku.description: A float representing the cost of battery energy per watt-hour.

gesamtlast.title: Gesamtlast
gesamtlast.description: An array of floats representing the total load (consumption) in watts for different time intervals.

GeneticEnergyManagementParameters.title: GeneticEnergyManagementParameters
GeneticEnergyManagementParameters.description: Encapsulates energy-related forecasts and costs used in GENETIC optimization.

temperature_forecast.title: Temperature Forecast
temperature_forecast.description: An array of floats representing the temperature forecast in degrees Celsius for different time intervals.

start_solution.title: Start Solution
start_solution.description: Can be `null` or contain a previous solution (if available).

GeneticOptimizationParameters.title: GeneticOptimizationParameters
GeneticOptimizationParameters.description:
Main parameter class for running the genetic energy optimization.

Collects all model and configuration parameters necessary to run the
optimization process, such as forecasts, pricing, battery and appliance models.

EAuto_SoC_pro_Stunde.title: Eauto Soc Pro Stunde
EAuto_SoC_pro_Stunde.description: The state of charge of the EV for each hour.

Einnahmen_Euro_pro_Stunde.title: Einnahmen Euro Pro Stunde
Einnahmen_Euro_pro_Stunde.description: The revenue from grid feed-in or other sources in euros per hour.

Gesamt_Verluste.title: Gesamt Verluste
Gesamt_Verluste.description: The total losses in watt-hours over the entire period.

Gesamtbilanz_Euro.title: Gesamtbilanz Euro
Gesamtbilanz_Euro.description: The total balance of revenues minus costs in euros.

Home_appliance_wh_per_hour.title: Home Appliance Wh Per Hour
Home_appliance_wh_per_hour.description: The energy consumption of a household appliance in watt-hours per hour.

Kosten_Euro_pro_Stunde.title: Kosten Euro Pro Stunde
Kosten_Euro_pro_Stunde.description: The costs in euros per hour.

Netzbezug_Wh_pro_Stunde.title: Netzbezug Wh Pro Stunde
Netzbezug_Wh_pro_Stunde.description: The grid energy drawn in watt-hours per hour.

Netzeinspeisung_Wh_pro_Stunde.title: Netzeinspeisung Wh Pro Stunde
Netzeinspeisung_Wh_pro_Stunde.description: The energy fed into the grid in watt-hours per hour.

Verluste_Pro_Stunde.title: Verluste Pro Stunde
Verluste_Pro_Stunde.description: The losses in watt-hours per hour.

akku_soc_pro_stunde.title: Akku Soc Pro Stunde
akku_soc_pro_stunde.description: The state of charge of the battery (not the EV) in percentage per hour.

GeneticSimulationResult.title: GeneticSimulationResult
GeneticSimulationResult.description: This object contains the results of the simulation and provides insights into various parameters over the entire forecast period.

ac_charge.title: Ac Charge
ac_charge.description: Array with AC charging values as relative power (0.0-1.0), other values set to 0.

dc_charge.title: Dc Charge
dc_charge.description: Array with DC charging values as relative power (0-1), other values set to 0.

discharge_allowed.title: Discharge Allowed
discharge_allowed.description: Array with discharge values (1 for discharge, 0 otherwise).

start_solution.title: Start Solution
start_solution.description: An array of binary values (0 or 1) representing a possible starting solution for the simulation.

washingstart.title: Washingstart
washingstart.description: Can be `null` or contain an object representing the start of washing (if applicable).

GeneticSolution.title: GeneticSolution
GeneticSolution.description: **Note**: The first value of "Last_Wh_per_hour", "Netzeinspeisung_Wh_per_hour", and "Netzbezug_Wh_per_hour", will be set to null in the JSON output and represented as NaN or None in the corresponding classes' data returns. This approach is adopted to ensure that the current hour's processing remains unchanged.

time_windows.description: Sequence of allowed time windows. Defaults to optimization general time window.
Sequence of allowed time windows. Defaults to optimization general time window.

measurement_keys.description: Measurement keys for the home appliance stati that are measurements.

hours.description: Number of prediction hours. Defaults to global config prediction hours.

consumption_wh.title: Consumption Wh
consumption_wh.description: An integer representing the energy consumption of a household device in watt-hours.

duration_h.title: Duration H
duration_h.description: An integer representing the usage duration of a household device in hours.

time_windows.description: List of allowed time windows. Defaults to optimization general time window.

battery_id.description: ID of battery controlled by this inverter.

LoadImportCommonSettings.description: Common settings for load data import from file or JSON string.

console_level.description: Logging level when logging to console.

file_path.description: Computed log file path based on data output path.

load_emr_keys.description: The keys of the measurements that are energy meter readings of a load [kWh].

grid_export_emr_keys.title: Grid Export Emr Keys
grid_export_emr_keys.description: The keys of the measurements that are energy meter readings of energy export to grid [kWh].

load_emr_keys.description: The keys of the measurements that are energy meter readings of a load [kWh].

grid_export_emr_keys.title: Grid Export Emr Keys
grid_export_emr_keys.description: The keys of the measurements that are energy meter readings of energy export to grid [kWh].

pv_production_emr_keys.description: The keys of the measurements that are PV production energy meter readings [kWh].

keys.title: Keys
keys.description: The keys of the measurements that can be stored.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the instruction in the ResourceManager scope. If not provided and a `resource_id` is passed at instantiation, this will be auto-generated as `{resource_id}@{UUID}`.

execution_time.title: Execution Time
execution_time.description: Start time of the instruction execution.

abnormal_condition.title: Abnormal Condition
abnormal_condition.description: Indicates if this is an instruction for abnormal conditions. Defaults to False.

operation_mode_id.title: Operation Mode Id
operation_mode_id.description: ID of the OMBC.OperationMode to activate.

operation_mode_factor.title: Operation Mode Factor
operation_mode_factor.description: Factor with which the operation mode is configured (0 to 1).

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

OMBCInstruction.title: OMBCInstruction
OMBCInstruction.description:
Instruction for Operation Mode Based Control (OMBC).

Contains information about when and how to activate a specific operation mode.
Used to command resources to change their operation at a specified time.

active_operation_mode_id.title: Active Operation Mode Id
active_operation_mode_id.description: ID of the currently active operation mode.

operation_mode_factor.title: Operation Mode Factor
operation_mode_factor.description: Factor with which the operation mode is configured (between 0 and 1).

previous_operation_mode_id.title: Previous Operation Mode Id
previous_operation_mode_id.description: ID of the previously active operation mode, if known.

transition_timestamp.title: Transition Timestamp
transition_timestamp.description: Timestamp of transition to the active operation mode, if applicable.

OMBCStatus.title: OMBCStatus
OMBCStatus.description:
Reports the current operational status of an Operation Mode Based Control system.

This model provides real-time status information about an OMBC-controlled device,
including which operation mode is currently active, how it is configured,
and information about recent mode transitions. It enables monitoring of the
device's operational state and tracking mode transition history.

horizon_hours.title: Horizon Hours
horizon_hours.description: The general time window within which the energy optimization goal shall be achieved [h]. Defaults to 24 hours.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique ID for the optimization solution.

generated_at.title: Generated At
generated_at.description: Timestamp when the solution was generated.

comment.title: Comment
comment.description: Optional comment or annotation for the solution.

valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: Start time of the optimization solution.

valid_until.title: Valid Until
valid_until.description: End time of the optimization solution.

total_losses_energy_wh.title: Total Losses Energy Wh
total_losses_energy_wh.description: The total losses in watt-hours over the entire period.

fitness_score.title: Fitness Score
fitness_score.description: The fitness score as a set of fitness values.

prediction.description: Datetime data frame with time series prediction data per optimization interval:- pv_energy_wh: PV energy prediction (positive) in wh- elec_price_amt_kwh: Electricity price prediction in money per kwh- feed_in_tariff_amt_kwh: Feed in tariff prediction in money per kwh- weather_temp_air_celcius: Temperature in °C- loadforecast_energy_wh: Load mean energy prediction in wh- loadakkudoktor_std_energy_wh: Load energy standard deviation prediction in wh- loadakkudoktor_mean_energy_wh: Load mean energy prediction in wh

solution.description: Datetime data frame with time series solution data per optimization interval:- load_energy_wh: Load of all energy consumers in wh- grid_energy_wh: Grid energy feed in (negative) or consumption (positive) in wh- costs_amt: Costs in money amount- revenue_amt: Revenue in money amount- losses_energy_wh: Energy losses in wh- <device-id>_operation_mode_id: Operation mode id of the device.- <device-id>_operation_mode_factor: Operation mode factor of the device.- <device-id>_soc_factor: State of charge of a battery/ electric vehicle device as factor of total capacity.- <device-id>_energy_wh: Energy consumption (positive) of a device in wh.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the instruction in the ResourceManager scope. If not provided and a `resource_id` is passed at instantiation, this will be auto-generated as `{resource_id}@{UUID}`.

execution_time.title: Execution Time
execution_time.description: Start time of the instruction execution.

abnormal_condition.title: Abnormal Condition
abnormal_condition.description: Indicates if this is an instruction for abnormal conditions. Defaults to False.

power_envelopes.title: Power Envelopes
power_envelopes.description: List of PowerEnvelopes to follow. One per CommodityQuantity, max one per type.

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

PEBCInstruction.title: PEBCInstruction
PEBCInstruction.description:
Represents a control instruction for Power Envelope Based Control.

This model defines a complete instruction for controlling a device using power
envelopes. It specifies when the instruction should be executed, which power
constraints apply, and the specific power envelopes to follow. It supports
multiple power envelopes for different commodity quantities.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of this PEBC.PowerEnvelope, scoped to the ResourceManager.

commodity_quantity.description: Type of power quantity the envelope applies to.

power_envelope_elements.title: Power Envelope Elements
power_envelope_elements.description: Chronologically ordered list of PowerEnvelopeElements. Defines how power should be constrained over time.

PEBCPowerEnvelope.title: PEBCPowerEnvelope
PEBCPowerEnvelope.description:
Defines a complete power envelope constraint for a specific commodity quantity.

This model specifies a time-series of power limits (upper and lower bounds) that
a device must operate within. The power envelope consists of sequential elements,
each defining constraints for a specific duration, creating a complete time-varying
operational boundary for the device.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of this power envelope element.

upper_limit.title: Upper Limit
upper_limit.description: Upper power limit for the given commodity_quantity. Shall match PEBC.AllowedLimitRange with limit_type UPPER_LIMIT.

lower_limit.title: Lower Limit
lower_limit.description: Lower power limit for the given commodity_quantity. Shall match PEBC.AllowedLimitRange with limit_type LOWER_LIMIT.

PEBCPowerEnvelopeElement.title: PEBCPowerEnvelopeElement
PEBCPowerEnvelopeElement.description:
Defines a segment of a power envelope for a specific duration.

This model specifies the upper and lower power limits for a specific time duration,
forming part of a complete power envelope. A sequence of these elements creates
a time-varying power envelope that constrains device power consumption or production.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the instruction in the ResourceManager scope. If not provided and a `resource_id` is passed at instantiation, this will be auto-generated as `{resource_id}@{UUID}`.

execution_time.title: Execution Time
execution_time.description: Start time of the instruction execution.

abnormal_condition.title: Abnormal Condition
abnormal_condition.description: Indicates if this is an instruction for abnormal conditions. Defaults to False.

power_profile_id.title: Power Profile Id
power_profile_id.description: ID of the PowerProfileDefinition related to the ended interruption.

sequence_container_id.title: Sequence Container Id
sequence_container_id.description: ID of the container containing the sequence.

power_sequence_id.title: Power Sequence Id
power_sequence_id.description: ID of the PowerSequence for which the interruption ends.

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

PPBCEndInterruptionInstruction.title: PPBCEndInterruptionInstruction
PPBCEndInterruptionInstruction.description:
Represents an instruction to resume execution of a previously interrupted power sequence.

This model defines a control instruction that ends an interruption and resumes
execution of a previously interrupted power sequence. It complements the start
interruption instruction, enabling the complete interruption-resumption cycle
for flexible sequence execution control.

sequence_container_status.title: Sequence Container Status
sequence_container_status.description: Status list for all sequence containers in the PowerProfileDefinition.

PPBCPowerProfileStatus-Input.title: PPBCPowerProfileStatus
PPBCPowerProfileStatus-Input.description:
Reports the current status of a power profile execution.

This model provides comprehensive status information for all sequence containers
in a power profile definition, enabling monitoring of profile execution progress.
It tracks which sequences have been selected and their current execution status.

sequence_container_status.title: Sequence Container Status
sequence_container_status.description: Status list for all sequence containers in the PowerProfileDefinition.

PPBCPowerProfileStatus-Output.title: PPBCPowerProfileStatus
PPBCPowerProfileStatus-Output.description:
Reports the current status of a power profile execution.

This model provides comprehensive status information for all sequence containers
in a power profile definition, enabling monitoring of profile execution progress.
It tracks which sequences have been selected and their current execution status.

sequence_container_id.title: Sequence Container Id
sequence_container_id.description: ID of the PowerSequenceContainer being reported on.

selected_sequence_id.title: Selected Sequence Id
selected_sequence_id.description: ID of the selected PowerSequence, if any.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: Elapsed time since the selected sequence started, if applicable.

PPBCPowerSequenceContainerStatus.title: PPBCPowerSequenceContainerStatus
PPBCPowerSequenceContainerStatus.description:
Reports the status of a specific power sequence container execution.

This model provides detailed status information for a single sequence container,
including which sequence was selected, the current execution progress, and the
operational status. It enables fine-grained monitoring of sequence execution
within the broader power profile.

PPBCPowerSequenceStatus.title: PPBCPowerSequenceStatus
PPBCPowerSequenceStatus.description: Enumeration of status values for Power Profile Based Control sequences.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the instruction in the ResourceManager scope. If not provided and a `resource_id` is passed at instantiation, this will be auto-generated as `{resource_id}@{UUID}`.

execution_time.title: Execution Time
execution_time.description: Start time of the instruction execution.

abnormal_condition.title: Abnormal Condition
abnormal_condition.description: Indicates if this is an instruction for abnormal conditions. Defaults to False.

power_profile_id.title: Power Profile Id
power_profile_id.description: ID of the PowerProfileDefinition being scheduled.

sequence_container_id.title: Sequence Container Id
sequence_container_id.description: ID of the container with the selected sequence.

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

PPBCScheduleInstruction.title: PPBCScheduleInstruction
PPBCScheduleInstruction.description:
Represents an instruction to schedule execution of a specific power sequence.

This model defines a control instruction that schedules the execution of a
selected power sequence from a power profile. It specifies which sequence
has been selected and when it should begin execution, enabling precise control
of device power behavior according to the predefined sequence.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the instruction in the ResourceManager scope. If not provided and a `resource_id` is passed at instantiation, this will be auto-generated as `{resource_id}@{UUID}`.

execution_time.title: Execution Time
execution_time.description: Start time of the instruction execution.

abnormal_condition.title: Abnormal Condition
abnormal_condition.description: Indicates if this is an instruction for abnormal conditions. Defaults to False.

power_profile_id.title: Power Profile Id
power_profile_id.description: ID of the PowerProfileDefinition whose sequence is being interrupted.

sequence_container_id.title: Sequence Container Id
sequence_container_id.description: ID of the container containing the sequence.

power_sequence_id.title: Power Sequence Id
power_sequence_id.description: ID of the PowerSequence to be interrupted.

resource_id.title: Resource Id
resource_id.description:
Get the resource identifier component from the instruction's `id`.

Assumes the `id` follows the format `{resource_id}@{UUID}`. Extracts the resource_id part
of the id by splitting at the last @.

Returns:
    str: The resource identifier prefix of `id`, or an empty string if `id` is None.

PPBCStartInterruptionInstruction.title: PPBCStartInterruptionInstruction
PPBCStartInterruptionInstruction.description:
Represents an instruction to interrupt execution of a running power sequence.

This model defines a control instruction that interrupts the execution of an
active power sequence. It enables dynamic control over sequence execution,
allowing temporary suspension of a sequence in response to changing system conditions
or requirements, particularly for sequences marked as interruptible.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: PVForecast provider id of provider to be used.

max_planes.title: Max Planes
max_planes.description: Maximum number of planes that can be set

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: PVForecast provider id of provider to be used.

max_planes.title: Max Planes
max_planes.description: Maximum number of planes that can be set

planes_peakpower.title: Planes Peakpower
planes_peakpower.description: Compute a list of the peak power per active planes.

planes_azimuth.title: Planes Azimuth
planes_azimuth.description: Compute a list of the azimuths per active planes.

planes_tilt.title: Planes Tilt
planes_tilt.description: Compute a list of the tilts per active planes.

planes_userhorizon.title: Planes Userhorizon
planes_userhorizon.description: Compute a list of the user horizon per active planes.

planes_inverter_paco.title: Planes Inverter Paco
planes_inverter_paco.description: Compute a list of the maximum power rating of the inverter per active planes.

import_file_path.title: Import File Path
import_file_path.description: Path to the file to import PV forecast data from.

import_json.title: Import Json
import_json.description: JSON string, dictionary of PV forecast value lists.

PVForecastImportCommonSettings.title: PVForecastImportCommonSettings
PVForecastImportCommonSettings.description: Common settings for pvforecast data import from file or JSON string.

surface_tilt.title: Surface Tilt
surface_tilt.description: Tilt angle from horizontal plane. Ignored for two-axis tracking.

surface_azimuth.title: Surface Azimuth
surface_azimuth.description: Orientation (azimuth angle) of the (fixed) plane. Clockwise from north (north=0, east=90, south=180, west=270).

userhorizon.title: Userhorizon
userhorizon.description: Elevation of horizon in degrees, at equally spaced azimuth clockwise from north.

peakpower.title: Peakpower
peakpower.description: Nominal power of PV system in kW.

mountingplace.title: Mountingplace
mountingplace.description: Type of mounting for PV system. Options are 'free' for free-standing and 'building' for building-integrated.

loss.title: Loss
loss.description: Sum of PV system losses in percent

trackingtype.title: Trackingtype
trackingtype.description: Type of suntracking. 0=fixed, 1=single horizontal axis aligned north-south, 2=two-axis tracking, 3=vertical axis tracking, 4=single horizontal axis aligned east-west, 5=single inclined axis aligned north-south.

optimal_surface_tilt.title: Optimal Surface Tilt
optimal_surface_tilt.description: Calculate the optimum tilt angle. Ignored for two-axis tracking.

optimalangles.title: Optimalangles
optimalangles.description: Calculate the optimum tilt and azimuth angles. Ignored for two-axis tracking.

albedo.title: Albedo
albedo.description: Proportion of the light hitting the ground that it reflects back.

module_model.title: Module Model
module_model.description: Model of the PV modules of this plane.

inverter_model.title: Inverter Model
inverter_model.description: Model of the inverter of this plane.

inverter_paco.title: Inverter Paco
inverter_paco.description: AC power rating of the inverter [W].

modules_per_string.title: Modules Per String
modules_per_string.description: Number of the PV modules of the strings of this plane.

strings_per_inverter.title: Strings Per Inverter
strings_per_inverter.description: Number of the strings of the inverter of this plane.

values.title: Values
values.description: Array of measured PowerValues. Shall contain at least one item and at most one item per 'commodity_quantity' (defined inside the PowerValue).

PowerMeasurement-Input.title: PowerMeasurement
PowerMeasurement-Input.description:
Captures a set of power measurements taken at a specific point in time.

This model records multiple power values (for different commodity quantities)
along with the timestamp when the measurements were taken, enabling time-series
analysis and monitoring of power consumption or production.

values.title: Values
values.description: Array of measured PowerValues. Shall contain at least one item and at most one item per 'commodity_quantity' (defined inside the PowerValue).

PowerMeasurement-Output.title: PowerMeasurement
PowerMeasurement-Output.description:
Captures a set of power measurements taken at a specific point in time.

This model records multiple power values (for different commodity quantities)
along with the timestamp when the measurements were taken, enabling time-series
analysis and monitoring of power consumption or production.

commodity_quantity.description: The power quantity the value refers to.

value.title: Value
value.description: Power value expressed in the unit associated with the CommodityQuantity.

PowerValue.title: PowerValue
PowerValue.description:
Represents a specific power value measurement with its associated commodity quantity.

This class links a numerical power value to a specific type of power quantity (such as
active power, reactive power, etc.) and its unit of measurement.

hours.title: Hours
hours.description: Number of hours into the future for predictions

historic_hours.title: Historic Hours
historic_hours.description: Number of hours into the past for historical predictions data

PredictionCommonSettings.title: PredictionCommonSettings
PredictionCommonSettings.description:
General Prediction Configuration.

This class provides configuration for prediction settings, allowing users to specify
parameters such as the forecast duration (in hours).
Validators ensure each parameter is within a specified range.

Attributes:
    hours (Optional[int]): Number of hours into the future for predictions.
        Must be non-negative.
    historic_hours (Optional[int]): Number of hours into the past for historical data.
        Must be non-negative.

Validators:
    validate_hours (int): Ensures `hours` is a non-negative integer.
    validate_historic_hours (int): Ensures `historic_hours` is a non-negative integer.

PydanticDateTimeData.title: PydanticDateTimeData
PydanticDateTimeData.description:
Pydantic model for time series data with consistent value lengths.

This model validates a dictionary where:
- Keys are strings representing data series names
- Values are lists of numeric or string values
- Special keys 'start_datetime' and 'interval' can contain string values
for time series indexing
- All value lists must have the same length

Example:
    {
        "start_datetime": "2024-01-01 00:00:00",  # optional
        "interval": "1 Hour",                     # optional
        "loadforecast_power_w": [20.5, 21.0, 22.1],
        "load_min": [18.5, 19.0, 20.1]
    }

datetime_columns.title: Datetime Columns
datetime_columns.description: Columns to be treated as datetime

PydanticDateTimeDataFrame.title: PydanticDateTimeDataFrame
PydanticDateTimeDataFrame.description: Pydantic model for validating pandas DataFrame data with datetime index.

PydanticDateTimeSeries.title: PydanticDateTimeSeries
PydanticDateTimeSeries.description:
Pydantic model for validating pandas Series with datetime index in JSON format.

This model handles Series data serialized with orient='index', where the keys are
datetime strings and values are the series values. Provides validation and
conversion between JSON and pandas Series with datetime index.

Attributes:
    data (Dict[str, Any]): Dictionary mapping datetime strings to values.
    dtype (str): The data type of the series values.
    tz (str | None): Timezone name if the datetime index is timezone-aware.

host.title: Host
host.description: EOS server IP address. Defaults to 127.0.0.1.

port.title: Port
port.description: EOS server IP port number. Defaults to 8503.

startup_eosdash.title: Startup Eosdash
startup_eosdash.description: EOS server to start EOSdash server. Defaults to True.

eosdash_host.title: Eosdash Host
eosdash_host.description: EOSdash server IP address. Defaults to EOS server IP address.

eosdash_port.title: Eosdash Port
eosdash_port.description: EOSdash server IP port number. Defaults to EOS server IP port number + 1.

SettingsEOS.title: SettingsEOS
SettingsEOS.description:
Settings for all EOS.

Only used to update the configuration with specific settings.

hours.title: Hours
hours.description: Number of prediction hours. Defaults to global config prediction hours.

capacity_wh.title: Capacity Wh
capacity_wh.description: An integer representing the capacity of the battery in watt-hours.

charging_efficiency.title: Charging Efficiency
charging_efficiency.description: A float representing the charging efficiency of the battery.

discharging_efficiency.title: Discharging Efficiency
discharging_efficiency.description: A float representing the discharge efficiency of the battery.

initial_soc_percentage.title: Initial Soc Percentage
initial_soc_percentage.description: An integer representing the state of charge of the battery at the **start** of the current hour (not the current state).

min_soc_percentage.title: Min Soc Percentage
min_soc_percentage.description: An integer representing the minimum state of charge (SOC) of the battery in percentage.

max_soc_percentage.title: Max Soc Percentage
max_soc_percentage.description: An integer representing the maximum state of charge (SOC) of the battery in percentage.

charge_rates.title: Charge Rates
charge_rates.description: Charge rates as factor of maximum charging power [0.00 ... 1.00]. None denotes all charge rates are available.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Start time of the time window (time of day).

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of the time window starting from `start_time`.

day_of_week.title: Day Of Week
day_of_week.description: Optional day of the week restriction. Can be specified as integer (0=Monday to 6=Sunday) or localized weekday name. If None, applies every day unless `date` is set.

date.title: Date
date.description: Optional specific calendar date for the time window. Overrides `day_of_week` if set.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Locale used to parse weekday names in `day_of_week` when given as string. If not set, Pendulum's default locale is used. Examples: 'en', 'de', 'fr', etc.

TimeWindow-Input.title: TimeWindow
TimeWindow-Input.description:
Model defining a daily or specific date time window with optional localization support.

Represents a time interval starting at `start_time` and lasting for `duration`.
Can restrict applicability to a specific day of the week or a specific calendar date.
Supports day names in multiple languages via locale-aware parsing.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Start time of the time window (time of day).

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of the time window starting from `start_time`.

day_of_week.title: Day Of Week
day_of_week.description: Optional day of the week restriction. Can be specified as integer (0=Monday to 6=Sunday) or localized weekday name. If None, applies every day unless `date` is set.

date.title: Date
date.description: Optional specific calendar date for the time window. Overrides `day_of_week` if set.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Locale used to parse weekday names in `day_of_week` when given as string. If not set, Pendulum's default locale is used. Examples: 'en', 'de', 'fr', etc.

TimeWindow-Output.title: TimeWindow
TimeWindow-Output.description:
Model defining a daily or specific date time window with optional localization support.

Represents a time interval starting at `start_time` and lasting for `duration`.
Can restrict applicability to a specific day of the week or a specific calendar date.
Supports day names in multiple languages via locale-aware parsing.

windows.title: Windows
windows.description: List of TimeWindow objects that make up this sequence.

TimeWindowSequence-Input.title: TimeWindowSequence
TimeWindowSequence-Input.description:
Model representing a sequence of time windows with collective operations.

Manages multiple TimeWindow objects and provides methods to work with them
as a cohesive unit for scheduling and availability checking.

windows.description: List of TimeWindow objects that make up this sequence.

TimeWindowSequence-Output.title: TimeWindowSequence
TimeWindowSequence-Output.description:
Model representing a sequence of time windows with collective operations.

Manages multiple TimeWindow objects and provides methods to work with them
as a cohesive unit for scheduling and availability checking.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Weather provider id of provider to be used.

provider.description: Weather provider id of provider to be used.

import_file_path.description: Path to the file to import weather data from.
